task_study.Description: Participants viewed words and provided Yes/No responses to either a shoebox or manmade judgments. Participants received either an informative cue (red or blue square), uninformative (white square), or uncued (no cue) about the judgment to make.

study_cb.Description: Stimulus file counterbalance with levels of ABCCBA,BCAACB, and CABBAC (A: informed, B = uninformed, C = uncued)

phase_name.Description: Block type and study list: Informed(1 or 2)_study(1-4), Uninformed(1-2)_study(1-4), or Uncued(1-2)_study(1-4)

study_phase.Description: Study phase block: inforemd1, informed2, uninformed1, uninformed2, uncued1, or uncued2

manmade.Description: Manmade judgment correct response: Y or N

shoebox.Description: Shoebox judgment correct response: Y or N

old_new.Description: Word is old or new for subsequent recognition task

study_judgment.Description: Judgment trial type: shoebox or manmade

cue_color.Description: Color of cue: cyan (manmade), red (shoebox), white (uninformed trial), n/a for uncued trials

box_color.Description: Color of box around the word: cyan (manmade), red (shoebox), white (informed trial)

show_cue.Description: Indicates if a cue (informed/uninformed trials) was shown for this trial: 1 (yes), 0 (no)

show_nocue.Description: Indicates if a no cue trial (uncued/no cue trials) was shown: 1 (yes), 0 (no)

study_resp_key.Description: Participants judgment response: j (yes) or k (no), and na for no responses

study_resp.Description: Participants numeric judgment response: 1 (j) or 2 (k), and -99 for no responses

study_rt.Description: Participants judgment reaction time, and -99 for no responses

study_good_trial.Description: Numerically mark if trial is good (1) or bad (0) based on if participants made a judgment response, see preregistration for more information
